creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-11-04T16:13-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Corporate, financial, legal, personnel, and real estate records of The Weiss & Klau Co., a distributor of oilcloth, plastic-coated fabrics, window shades, and related products. The collection also includes the records of a subsidiary, Standard Coated Products, Inc., a manufacturer of these products. Photographs and memorabilia of company social functions are also present, as is some personal correspondence.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as The Records of The Weiss & Klau, Co., MS 687, The New-York Historical Society.

The collection supports research in New York City business administrative history from the late nineteenth through the mid-twentieth century. In addition, materials relating to employee relations and social functions provide insight into organizational culture and the environment of the work place in this time period.

dsc.value:
Series I: Corporate Documents, 1896-1968 Scope and Contents note

This series contains materials related to The Weiss & Klau Co.'s status as a corporation, including board minutes, resolutions, stock certificate books, and other materials. Also included are the general correspondence of the company, materials related to trademarks, and records retention schedules.

Materials related to the distribution of Weiss & Klau stock in Box 2, Folder 3 are restricted until 2043, 75 years from the date of their creation.

 Corporate Documents and Agreements 1 1 1896-1908 Board Minutes 1 2 1898-1910 Board Minutes 1 3 1966-1967 Board Minutes 1 4 1968 Corporate Resolution 1 5 1943 Correspondence 1 6 1898-1947 Corporate and Financial Summaries--All Companies 1 7 1923-1968 Stock Certificate Book 1 8 1947-1959 Stock Certificate Book 1 9 1959-1968 Bond Registers 2 1 1963 Stock Valuation 2 2 1962 Distribution of W & K Stock (RESTRICTED) 2 3 1962-1968 Redemption of W & K Stock 2 4 1965 SANITAS Trademark 2 5 1965-1966 Certificates of Incorporation and Merger--Napaul Corporation 2 6 Napaul Corporation--By-Laws, Certificate of Merger 2 7 1962-1963 Summons 2 8 1968 Records Retention Schedule 2 9 1962-1966 List of Document Locations 2 10 n.d. Series II: Financial Documents, 1902-1969 Scope and Contents note

This series contains financial documents, including inventory records, balance sheets, account books, investment reports, sales figures, and tax returns of The Weiss & Klau Co., its related companies, and its principal investors.

 Inventory Record 2 11 1903-1914 Inventory 2 12 1925 Check and Receipt 2 13 1902-1919 Balance Sheet 2 14 1922 Balance Sheet 2 15 1955-1965 Consolidation of Balance Sheets and Income Accounts 2 16 1955-1965 Account Book 2 17 1966 Account Book 3 1 1967 Account Book 3 2 1968 Profit and Loss Accounts 3 3 1956-1969 Report on Financial Statements 3 4 1965-1968 Projections 3 5 1966 Projected Statements of Income 3 6 1966 Financial Records 3 7 1936-1954 Financial Records 3 8 1956-1965 Financial Records 3 9 1958-1964 Financial Records 3 10 1965 Financial Records 3 11 1966 Financial Records 3 12 1967 Consolidated Net Assets of All Companies 4 1 1948-1963 Assets of Companies and Persons 4 2 1955-1960 Schedule of Investments 4 3 1922-1923 Investments 4 4 1967 FAB Department Records 4 5 1951-1963 Sales Binder 4 6 1964-1966 Salesmanship Manual 4 7 1946 Capital Stock Tax Return 4 8 1942-1945 Tax Estimates 4 9 1964-1965 Tax Materials 4 10 1966-1967 Audits 4 11 1964-1966 Series III: Real Estate Documents, 1912-1981 Scope and Contents note

The Weiss & Klau Co. moved into its home at 462-468 Broadway in 1911. This series contains legal and real estate documents relating to the purchase (and sale) of the building, lease agreements, repairs and construction work. This series also contains information relating to the partial collapse of the building in 1966. There are clippings from several New York City papers; correspondence with employees, attorneys, and actuaries; building violations; and materials relating to insurance and liability claims.

 Real Estate Documents 4 12 1912-1922 Real Estate Documents 4 13 1939-1942 Real Estate Documents 4 14 1943 Real Estate Documents 4 15 1945-1946 Real Estate Documents 4 16 1947-1948 Real Estate Documents 5 1 1949-1958 Real Estate Documents 5 2 1960-1970 Annual Vault Charge 5 3 1962-1967 Notes, Drawings Re: Building Collapse 5 4 1966 Sale of Building--Correspondence, Notes, Clippings 5 5 1966, 1981 Building Violations 5 6 1966 Lists of Injured Employees 5 7 1966 Insurance Claims, Correspondence, Notes 5 8 1966 Lawsuit--Legal Documents, Correspondence, Notes 5 9 1966-1967 Newspaper Clippings--Building Collapse 5 10 1966 Newspaper Clippings--Sale of Business 5 11 1966 Registration of Insured Boiler 5 12 1968 Series IV: Personnel Documents, 1936-1981 Scope and Contents note

This series contains the personnel records of Weiss & Klau employees, as well as extensive materials relating to the pension plan created for employees following the building collapse in 1966.

The personnel records contained in Box 5, Folders 13 and 14, are restricted until 2042, 75 years from the last date of their creation.

Scope and Contents note

Standard Coated Products, Inc. (known until 1937 as Standard Textile Products, Inc.) was Weiss & Klau's largest supplier of oilcloth and other textile products. Standard Coated was purchased by Weiss & Klau from Interchemical Corporation in 1953. This series contains correspondence, financial records, marketing reports, legal documents, clippings, and other materials relating to Standard Coated dating from both before and after its acquisition by Weiss & Klau.

Appraisal of Standard Coated Products 8 11 1958 Standard Coated Products--Financial Statements 8 12 1954-1964 Standard Coated Products--Financial Records 9 1 1958-1960 Standard Coated Products--Financial Records 9 2 1961-1963 Standard Coated Products--Financial Records 9 3 1964-1965 Interchemical Review 9 4 1949 Market Outlook for Oilcloth 9 5 1949 Outlook for Coated Products Division, Interchemical Corp. 9 6 1952 Studies--Combination of Standard Coated Products and Weiss & Klau 9 7 1966 Series VI: Sale and Liquidation, 1890-1973 Scope and Contents note

Following the collapse of 462 Broadway, portions of The Weiss & Klau Co. were sold to different companies. This series contains correspondence, notes, legal, and financial documents relating to the purchase of the plastic stock window shade business by Breneman, Inc. in February 1966, the plastic film and tile business by Clopay Corporation in March 1966, and the manufacturing business of Standard Coated Products, Inc. by American Cyanamid Corporation in 1968. It also contains materials relating to the final liquidation of stock and assets of The Weiss & Klau Co. In addition, correspondence, notes, and other materials relating to unsuccessful bids to purchase Weiss & Klau, both before and after the building collapse are found here. In particular, there is a considerable amount of information relating to a possible merger with DeSoto Chemical Coatings. Finally, this series contains Dun & Bradstreet Reports on Weiss & Klau and their competitors.

 Dun & Bradstreet Reports 9 8 1890-1948 Offers to Purchase Business--Correspondence 9 9 1956-1967 Offers to Purchase Business--Notes, Annual Reports 9 10 1963-1965 Proposed Purchase of Ru-Son Products 9 11 1963 Corporate Research Materials--DeSoto Chemical Coatings 10 1 1957-1966 Correspondence, Notes--DeSoto Chemical Coatings 10 2 1957-1966 Breneman, Inc. 10 3 1966-1973 Breneman, Clopay, Newell 10 4 1966-1967 Clopay Corporation 10 5 1956-1968 Sale of Assets to Clopay Corporation 10 6 1966 Sale of Industrial Fabrics Division 10 7 1966 Sale of Industrial Fabrics Division 10 8 1966 Sale of Industrial Fabrics Division 10 9 1966-1967 Ameican Cyanamid--Annual Reports, Advertising 10 10 1964-1968 American Cyanamid--Correspondence, Notes 11 1 1965-1971 Sale of Assets to American Cyanamid Company 11 2 1968 Sale to American Cyanamid--Marked Copies of Agreement 11 3 1968 462 Broadway Corp.--Board Minutes, Resolution 11 4 1966 Liquidation of 462 Broadway Corp. 11 5 1965-1967 Liquidation 11 6 1967-1968 Corporate Dissolution 11 7 1968 Liquidation 12 1 1968 Liquidation 12 2 1969 Liquidation 12 3 1970-1972 Notes re: Liquidation 12 4 1966-1967 Outline of Will of David Klau 12 5 1957 Series VII: Social Functions and Activities, 1915-1988 Scope and Contents note

The Weiss & Klau Co. regularly hosted parties and other events for its employees. This series contains programs from dinners, as well as materials relating to large parties held in honor of the fiftieth and seventy-fifth anniversaries of the company. In addition, there are company newsletters, many of which contain personal information about employees, such as wedding, birth, and death announcements, work-related news, jokes, and cartoons. This series also contains materials relating to two employee social organizations, The Quarter-Century Club and The Old Bunch. Finally, this series contains the personal correspondence of Ira L. Oppenheimer, its last president, with employees, friends, and associates.

 Dance Programs 12 6 1915-1939 Fiftieth Anniversary--Speeches, Correspondence 12 7 1936-1937 Fiftieth Anniversary--Mailing List, Broadside 12 8 1936 Seventy-Fifth Anniversary--Budget, Invoices, Notes 12 9 1962 Employee Newsletter 12 10 1928-1970 Quarter-Century Club--Membership Lists 12 11 1955-1982 Quarter-Century Club--Announcements 12 12 1968-1971, n.d. Quarter-Century Club--Correspondence, Notes 12 13 1968-1982 Quarter-Century Club--Correspondence, Notes 13 1 1983-1988 The Old Bunch 13 2 1968-1971 Speeches 13 3 1958-1961, n.d. Clipping 13 4 1961 Correspondence of Ira L. Oppenheimer 13 5 1961-1971 Series VII: Scrapbooks, Photographs, and Ephemera, 1896-1966, n.d. Scope and Contents note

This series consists primarily of two scrapbooks containing photographs, newsletters, newspaper clippings, certificates, advertisements, correspondence, cartoons, and other materials pertaining to The Weiss & Klau Co., its employees, its related businesses, and the Klau family. Some of these materials appear elsewhere in the collection. Many of the materials date from the early twentieth century. There are a number of group photographs taken at company dinners. Individuals have been identified in several of these photographs. One scrapbook containing oversized materials has been disbound, and the contents have been arranged in folders. The other scrapbook remains in its original condition. In addition, this series contains business-related ephemera, such as announcements and business cards, additional photographs, and a wooden printing block used by the firm of Weiss & Klau Brothers.
